main.name: Srushti Shah
main.description: Coding, books and music are my survival assets
main.bio: Welcome to my portfolio website! I am a Master of Engineering student majoring in Computer Engineering at . I have been learning to code since Grade 11 and know various programming languages like C, C++, JavaScript, PHP and Python. Frontend Web Development has been one of my major interests, and I have worked with HTML5, CSS, Javascript, Bootstrap, TailwindCSS, MaterialUI, React.js and NodeJS to build personal projects as well as for internship projects and interview tasks. Furthermore, I have managed to learn C#, .NET framework, and Visual Studio 2019 to build a desktop project as part of my internship with Space Applications Center, ISRO. Being an enthusiast for Artificial Intelligence, I strive to dive deep into the field and bring my ideas to life. Currently, I am applying for a degree of Master of Science in Computer Science with an aim to specialize in Artificial Intelligence in the United States. It would be right to call me a nerd, as I am ever-ready to code or read a book. After an exhausting day of work or study, I revitalize by enjoying mystery thriller books and Bollywood songs that incorporate Indian classical music.
main.contactmessage: Get in touch with me to know more!

education.school: The New Tulip International School, Ahmedabad
The New Tulip International School, Ahmedabad

work.title: React Development Intern
work.description: I worked on developing my expertise in the concepts of React which included class and functional components, hooks, React Router, and Redux. I applied these skills to building multiple client modules with enhanced UI and functionalities, as well as improving previous modules as per client requirements, working on bugs and adding new features.

work.company: Bhaskaracharya National Institute for Space Applications and Geo-informatics
work.title: Research Intern
work.description: Perform EDA on Air Quality dataset taken from Kaggle of 146 Indian cities ranging from 2013 to 2022, and trained the dataset on various models like Linear Regression, Decision Tree Regression, and Neural Network to accurately predict the Air Quality Index. Due to the huge size of the dataset, I configured the CUDA and CudNN to utilise the GPU and increase the efficiency of model training.

work.title: Research Intern
work.description: I worked in the Quantum Communication department, building a Windows Desktop Software for displaying communicated parameters for continuous monitoring using Visual Studio 2019 and C# as my tools. I also did some reading on Quantum Communication, its background and the possibilities it presents. I built this application along with a fellow intern under the guidance of a senior scientist and mentors from within the department.
